data.message: Dear Facebook! There are so many functions which you severely lack! Where can users leave feedback so that you would at least think of implementing them? For example, the possibility to stop your friends from seeing every single comment you leave elsewhere would be a nice thing to have. I don't like my friends spying on me whenever I leave a comment somewhere, I connect with people just to keep in touch, not to inform them about my every move online :))) The same goes about my likes elsewhere. It would be also great if you could create posts in your newsfeed without possibility for others to comment - only for some posts, without switching this feature off globally. And a lot of other things.

replies.message: Thanks for your feedback, Katya. We truly appreciate all feedback from the Facebook community, and we use it to help inform our decisions. You can let us know what would make your experience more enjoyable here: http://bit.ly/2AZStrT. -Mollie
The FB does not answer any FBs that are not people just machine response machine
They do implement some of the features requested. After all, they added the option to dislike comments and posts :)))
I agree with this. This is sorely needed!
Ahmed AlSharkawy Abanoub Moner Khaled Hoza Shereen H. Samy Mostafa Gamal .. read katya’s comment 😕

Every time I bring up the issue of changing Facebook's blocking policy, the conversation stops! No one wants to even talk about that! No one wants to Mark Zuckerburg about changing this annoying policy! I guess this with keep on as long as there are people who are on Facebook doing nothing but advertising their business!
